titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Thomas Moore papers, 1804-1847 MS 015
titlestmt.author: Daphne Dean

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Boxes 1-3 stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586. Box 4 located onsite at Woodson Research Center in the small manuscript section.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-07-08 12:44:39 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.abstract: Chiefly letters of Moore; together with correspondence, poems, engravings, clippings, and photos. Includes material relating to Wilfred S. Dowden, editor of Moore's letters. Correspondents include William Lisle Bowles, Lord and Lady Holland, Thomas Longman, Ellen Moore, James Power, Lord John Russell, Sir Walter Scott, and Mary Shelley.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Irish poet Thomas Moore was born in Dublin on May 28, 1779. His earliest poetic compositions appeared in Anthologia Hibernica during the years 1792-1795. He briefly studied law in London, and other than a brief foray into parliamentary politics, the primary focuses of his life were poetry and the cultivation of aristocratic society. Irish Melodies is his most lasting claim to fame, and this work has been credited with both preserving and popularising the numerous ancient Irish airs which form its core.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers, 1804-1847, of Thomas Moore consist of letters, photographs and engravings, newspaper articles and clippings, poems and correspondence.

The letters are arranged chronologically and divided into numbered and unnumbered originals and copies. The numbered letters, originals and copies are those included in the two volume edition, The Letters of Thomas Moore, edited by Wilfred S. Dowden (Oxford: Oxford University Press, 1964.) Of the 1,323 numbered letters contained in the book, this collection has 223; 156 originals and 67 copies. The numbering on this list corresponds to the numbering system devised by Dr. Dowden. The unnumbered letters are those not included in The Letters of Thomas Moore, but which span the same time period and include both original letters and copies.

The letters are arranged in the following manner: I. Numbered Originals, II. Unnumbered Originals, III. Numbered Copies, and IV. Unnumbered Copies. Numbered originals consist of those original letters contained in Dowden's work. Unnumbered originals include letters written by Moore, letter fragments and miscellaneous envelopes addressed or signed by Moore, some printed material about Moore and letters to Moore. Numbered copies consists of photocopies of letters written by Moore and included in the published edition. Among a variety of items found in the unnumbered copies are copies of letters letters written by Moore, copies of letters written to Moore, correspondence written concerning Moore and his works, and correspondence concerning the purchase of Moore material and excerpts from catalogues advertising Moore material. In addition to the numbered and unnumbered catagories mentioned above, there is a Commonplace Book contained in a black notebook filled with photocopies of pages in Moore's handwriting.
Box 1 contains only numbered originals; box 2 contains numbered originals and unnumbered originals, numbered and unnumbered copies, microfilm, and the Commonplace Book.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Boxes 1-3 stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586. Box 4 located onsite at Woodson Research Center in the small manuscript section.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from Thomas Moore letters must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Thomas Moore papers, 1804-1847, MS 15, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: The following abbreviations may appear in the collection indicating specific types of original documents:
A.D.=Autograph Document (i.e., any handwritten manuscript that is not a letter, memorandum, or diary)
D.S.=Document Signed (the body of the document is written or printed by someone other than the signer)

Series V: Addenda to Thomas Moore Letters

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection is a continuation of Woodson Research Library's earlier collection of the Letters of Thomas Moore (MS 015). The letters collected were purchased from Winifred A. Meyers (Autographs), Ltd. and Kenneth W. Rendell, Inc. Also included are four engravings of the poet, purchased from Colburn and Tegg (Hollis, New York.). These purchases were made between 1976 and 1978.

Series VI: Thomas Moore Letters on Microfilm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Eight small boxes of microfilm are included in the collection:

did.unittitle: Letters and Notes Held at Pierpont Morgan Library

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 16 autographed letters and/or notes for the period 1802-1843. Recipients include J. Taylor, James Carpenter, James Power, Samuel Rogers. Several of the addressees are unknown. Also included is an undated check. Originals of thes microfilm are in the Pierpont Morgan Library. Items on the microfilm are not to be reproduced or quoted without the express permission of the Trustees of the Pierpont Morgan Library.

did.unittitle: Manuscripts and Music Held at the National Library of Ireland

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: ALS, Ms, ANS, AL, DS, and music. About 70 items in all, covering the period 1802-1852. Among the adressees are James Perry, the Morning Chronicle, Robert Montgomery, T. S. Rice, D. F. Ryan, Edward R. Moran, Richard Bentley. Also included are Thomas Moore's will, and the Certificate of Administration of Thomas Moore's will (originals in the Bristol District Registry). Originals are housed in the National Library of Ireland. Items may not be reproduced without the permission of the National Library of Ireland.

did.unittitle: Letters and Notes Held at the Huntington Library

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 27 autographed letters and notes written by Moore between 1810 and 1845. Among the addressees (most of whom are unknown) are James Power, James Carpenter and William L. Bowles. Included on the microfilm are 2 pages from Moore's "Life of Sir Edward Fitzgerald" (typescript). Originals are located in the Huntington Library and Art Gallery. Written permission to quote from, to reproduce, or to reprint must be obtained from copyright owners (if material is copyrighted) or from the Director of the Huntington Library.

did.unittitle: Letters Held at the Historical Society of Pennsylvania

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 14 autographed letters between 1812 and 1844. Addressees include James Power, James Carpenter and Washington Irving. An inventory of the film's contents and a restriction statement precedes the letters. Originals owned by the Historical Society of Pennsylvania.

did.unittitle: Letters, Notes, and Manuscripts Held at the Harvard College Library

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 27 autographed letters, notes and manuscripts written by Moore between 1813 and 1844. Addressees include James Carpenter, James Power, William Bowles, Richard Bentley, Edward Moxon and others. Microfilm made by the Harvard College Library. No restriction statement on film.

did.unittitle: Letters Held at the Historical Society of Pennsylvania

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters written between 1815-1829. Addressees include Mr. James Power. Originals located in the Historical Society of Pennsylvania; and the right to reproduce the material must be secured from the Director of the Society, applied for and granted in writing. A partial inventory precedes the film.

did.unittitle: Letters Held at the Huntington Library

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 7 ALS dated 1815-1843. Addressees are Mr. Longman, Mrs. Belcher; other unknown; certain letters pertain to musical matters. Originals are located in the Huntington Library and Art Gallery. Written permission to quote from, to reproduce, or to reprint material must be obtained from the copyright owner (copyrighted material) or from the Director of the Huntington Library. A partial inventory and restriction statement precedes the film.

did.unittitle: Letters Held at Trinity College Library

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 4 ALS written around 1830 by Moore. Three of the letters are in the Trinity College Library; the other is the property of Lieutenant-Col. M. O'C. Fitzsimmon of Glencullen Co., Dublin. There is no inventory or restriction statement on the microfilm.

did.unittitle: Series VII: Addenda to Thomas Moore Letters (Oversize)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: (Sm. Ms. box) Corrected galleys of poems, including the following titles, and digitized copy on DVD:

did.unittitle: The Living Dog and the Dead Lion
A Hymn of Welcome After the Recess
All in the Family Way, a new pastoral ballad
An Incantation, sung by the bubble spirit
